instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2015, does not recognize internal SSD
threads.message:
Board works fine with external drive, but does not recognize internal SSD at all. Apple Hardware Test comes back with error VDH002 ("issue with a storage device"). There was corrosion on the board underside, which I cleaned up and does not appear to be in any SSD-related areas (Thunderbolt, screen backlight). There's also what looks like a small burn hole on the board topside right under the SSD (which leads me to believe that something on the original SSD had exploded).. I scraped the hole area but no vias of importance seem to run through there.

I've never had to fix SSD-relate issues, so any pointers would be helpful.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2015, does not recognize internal SSD
threads.message:
Check L3700 first.
Post <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> voltages, with SSD inserted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2015, does not recognize internal SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2015, does not recognize internal SSD
threads.message:
"L3700 is at 3.35V"
Both pins?

Check <RESISTOR>R3701</RESISTOR>, clean J3700, resolder its pins.
Also check all the caps from PCIE lines (<CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17).
Just in case, change <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2015, does not recognize internal SSD
threads.message:
Both pins of L3700 are at 3.4V. The SSD definitely has power; it gets warm.
<RESISTOR>R3701</RESISTOR> is NOSTUFF on this model.
Replaced J3700.
Caps <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17 are good.
Replaced <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3711</CHIP>, and <CHIP>U3740</CHIP>.

No improvement.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2015, does not recognize internal SSD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2015, does not recognize internal SSD
threads.message: Success! I found an interrupted via next to <RESISTOR>R3707</RESISTOR>, which prevented <RESISTOR>R3707</RESISTOR> and the PCIE line from working. Fully functional now. Thank you!
